content: chenille carpetbag skill level easy finished size approx 16* wide at bottom 12* wide at top x 11* deep materials 300 yds sport-wt chenille sample shown in a coned yarn called pasa a sport-wt multicolor chenille size h/8 5 mm crochet hook or size needed to achieve gauge tapestry needle wooden purse handles with 12* slit opening for insertion of crochet piece 18 x 24 piece of fabric for purse lining gauge 4 sts = 1 in double_crochet on size h/8 5 mm hook stitches/terms back loop only blo beginning beg chain chain double_crochet double_crochet half double_crochet half_double_crochet work every row in back loop only blo 1 removable stitch markers help identify single half double and double_crochet sections move them up as you work bag row 1 chain 101 single_crochet in second chain from hook and next 19 chain place removable stitch marker pm half_double_crochet in next 20 chain pm double_crochet in next 20 chain pm half_double_crochet in next 20 chain pm single_crochet in last 20 chain row 2 chain 1 turn single_crochet in back loop only blo across 20 single_crochet half_double_crochet in blo across 20 half_double_crochet double_crochet in blo across 20 double_crochet half_double_crochet in blo across 20 half_double_crochet single_crochet in blo across last 20 single_crochet repeat row 2 until width of bag at single_crochet ends measures same length as purse handle slit opening fasten_off finishing fold crocheted piece in half matching beginning chain row to final row ribs will run vertically attach yarn at side and slip st side seams together leaving single_crochet portion unsewn insert single_crochet portion through purse handle fold over and sew securely on inside of bag cut piece of fabric to size of crocheted piece then sew sides in a ¼ to ½
